title: Did Trump hit bulls‚Äôs eye with tariffs? Why India, China may stop buying Russian oil ‚Äî explained
content: US President Donald Trump's sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil may compel India and China to halt crude imports. While tariffs proved insufficient, these sanctions block financial transactions, making trade nearly impossible.

title: Kurnool bus tragedy: Drunk biker skids, dies moments before bus collision; CCTV footage surfaces
content: A tragic bus fire killing 19 passengers was caused by the bus running over a skidded motorcycle. CCTV footage revealed the bike had fallen before the bus approached. The driver claims he didn't realize he hit the bike until friction caused the fuel tank to explode, trapping passengers inside.

title: Shocking! Is Rohit to blame for Gill‚Äôs ODI struggles? Ex-India selector speaks out
content: Shubman Gill's recent struggles in white-ball cricket, marked by a low run tally in Australia and the Asia Cup, have drawn scrutiny. Experts attribute his dip in form to an extensive workload, captaincy pressures, and the challenge of replacing Rohit Sharma, all impacting his batting performance.

title: Satish Shah funeral: Rupali Ganguly, Ratna Pathak & more pay tribute
content: The Indian entertainment industry mourns the sudden passing of veteran actor Satish Shah, aged 74, due to kidney failure. Known for his iconic role in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' and numerous films, Shah's demise has left colleagues and fans deeply saddened. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Anupam Kher were among those who paid heartfelt tributes to the beloved actor.

title: GitHub is in trouble from AI; Gates complained, Nadella agrees
content: Microsoft is revamping GitHub to tackle AI coding rivals like Cursor and Claude Code. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted the need to unify development tools, drawing parallels to Bill Gates' past vision.  The platform aims to integrate AI across all developer workflows, ensuring choice in models and surfaces to regain developer mindshare.

title: UP horror: Woman forced into 2 abortions; sexually abused by in-laws over male child demand
content: A Kanpur woman alleges she was subjected to severe abuse, including forced abortions and sexual assault, by her husband's family due to their desire for a male heir. After giving birth to a daughter, she was allegedly forced into two abortions following illegal sex determination tests. The harassment escalated, leading to her expulsion from the home.

title: Allowance hike, pension & more: INDIA bloc‚Äôs poll promises for ‚Äònew Bihar‚Äô; perks for Panchayat heads
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav announced welfare measures for Bihar's Panchayati Raj representatives if the INDIA bloc wins the upcoming elections. Promises include increased PDS distributor margins, pension schemes, and a Rs 50 lakh insurance cover for Panchayat and Gram Kachari representatives. Yadav urged voters to give the INDIA bloc 20 months to bring about change in Bihar.

title: IIT Kharagpur non-JEE admissions: Olympiad, sports achievers eligible; check others
content: IIT Kharagpur is opening doors for Olympiad winners and national/international sports medalists, allowing admission without JEE ranks from 2026. This initiative, inspired by other IITs, aims to diversify talent and recognize achievements beyond traditional exams. New pathways, SCOPE and SEA, will be introduced, integrating with JoSAA for national-level talent recognition.

title: Don‚Äôt donate to Gates: Thiel warns Musk; Tesla CEO says ‚Äògive it to my children‚Äô
content: PayPal co-founder Peter Thiel reportedly advised Elon Musk against joining the Giving Pledge, fearing his vast fortune could inadvertently fund rivals like Bill Gates. Thiel suggested Musk's wealth could act as a bulwark against a potential global "Antichrist" figure, but only if it isn't seized by taxes or sanctions.

title: PPF rules: Why Kerala HC asked a mother to return extra interest in kids‚Äô accounts - Explained
content: The Kerala High Court has ruled that deposits in minor children's PPF accounts are combined with the guardian's account for annual deposit limits. Excess interest earned on these over-limit deposits made while the children were minors can be lawfully recovered by the Post Office, clarifying deposit clubbing rules.

title: Retirement? Ravi Shastri panics after Virat Kohli‚Äôs one-word reply - Watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's stellar partnership prevented a series whitewash in Australia, with Rohit scoring an unbeaten 121 and Kohli 74 not out. Their unbroken 168-run stand guided India to a nine-wicket victory. The duo expressed gratitude for their experiences playing in Australia, highlighting their enduring chemistry and the lessons learned throughout their careers.

title: 'SoS, there‚Äôs a guy following us‚Äô: 2 Australian cricketers molested; accused tried to grab one
content: Two Australian cricketers were allegedly stalked and molested by a man in Indore while walking to a cafe. The accused, Akil Khan, was arrested after CCTV footage and a complaint from the team's security manager. The incident occurred near the team hotel, prompting an investigation into security protocols. The Australian team did not comment on the matter post-match.

title: ‚Äò13,000x faster‚Äô: Sundar Pichai hails ‚Äòverifiable quantum edge‚Äô; Musk reacts
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Satish Shah's demise: Rupali Ganguly gets emotional
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, renowned for his role as Indravadhan in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', passed away at 74 due to kidney failure. His co-stars from the iconic show gathered to pay their respects, remembering him as a father figure whose off-screen bond mirrored his on-screen chemistry.

title: 'People are waiting for Virat, Rohit to fail': Ex-India cricketer‚Äôs shocking claim
content: Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif defends Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, suggesting selectors await their failure for ODI removal before the 2027 World Cup.  He highlighted their match-winning partnership in Sydney, proving their enduring class and determination to depart on their own terms. Kaif stressed their vital experience on South Africa's challenging pitches, deeming them indispensable.

title: Nina Lin apologizes after viral clip resurfaces of Said trying to escape livestream
content: Twitch streamers Nina Lin and Zoe Spencer have had their channels suspended after an old livestream resurfaced, showing them twerking on a visibly uncomfortable FaZe Silky's assistant, Said. Lin apologized, admitting she was wrong and that Said was clearly hurt, but faced backlash for the delayed response. Viewers are demanding fair treatment and accountability from Twitch.

title: Mann Ki Baat: PM lauds Chhath, Op Sindoor success; highlights environmental initiatives
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his 'Mann Ki Baat' address, highlighted Chhath Puja as a symbol of social unity and praised the armed forces' success in Operation Sindoor. He also lauded environmental initiatives like the 'Garbage Caf√©' and mangrove plantations, encouraging the adoption of Indian dog breeds and remembering Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

title: Trump praises Asim Munir, Shehbaz Sharif; vows to end Pakistan-Afghanistan conflict
content: President Trump praised Pakistani leaders and vowed to quickly resolve the Pakistan-Afghanistan conflict, claiming his administration has ended eight wars in eight months. He expressed confidence in his ability to mediate peace, stating he can save millions of lives. India, however, maintains no third-party mediation was involved in its ceasefire understanding with Pakistan.

title: ‚ÄòShe wanted to marry me‚Äô: Arrested Pune techie on doctor who died by suicide; probe takes new twist
content: A techie and a police sub-inspector were arrested in Satara for allegedly raping and abetting the suicide of a 28-year-old doctor. The techie's family claims the doctor harassed him, while police found chats indicating her stress. The doctor's suicide note named the two accused.

title: J'khand shocker: 5 kids with thalassemia test HIV-positive; blood transfusion suspected
content: In a heartbreaking turn of events, the small town of Chaibasa is grappling with a devastating crisis as five children suffering from thalassemia have tested positive for HIV. This alarming discovery follows serious allegations regarding contaminated blood transfusions from a nearby blood bank.

title: Asean summit: Trump‚Äôs Asia tour, PM Modi's virtual presence & more‚Äì here‚Äôs what to expect
content: Southeast Asian leaders convene in Kuala Lumpur for the 47th ASEAN Summit, marked by East Timor's historic 11th-member induction. Discussions will cover regional security, economic integration, and climate action, with key global powers in attendance. The summit also features a peace deal signing between Cambodia and Thailand, mediated by Malaysia.

title: 5 fruits that help manage high uric acid
content: High uric acid levels can be managed with diet. Certain fruits offer natural relief. Citrus fruits like lemons and oranges, rich in Vitamin C, aid kidney function. Berries, packed with antioxidants, help fight inflammation. Cherries contain anthocyanins that lower uric acid. Bananas, high in potassium, support efficient kidney function. Pineapple's bromelain reduces joint pain.

title: Donald Trump oversees signing of ‚Äòhistoric‚Äô Thailand‚ÄìCambodia peace deal
content: President Trump brokered an expanded ceasefire between Cambodia and Thailand, ending a border conflict that caused dozens of deaths. The agreement, signed at the ASEAN summit, also includes the release of Cambodian soldiers and the removal of heavy weapons. Trump also secured trade and critical minerals deals with the nations.

title: Double gold for Gukesh, Divya; Sarin, Puranik also shine at ECC
content: Indian chess stars shone brightly at the European Club Cup 2025. SuperChess clinched the Open title with a flawless record, while Cercle d'√©checs de Monte-Carlo dominated the Women's competition. World Champion Gukesh and GM Divya Deshmukh delivered stellar performances, securing individual accolades and highlighting India's growing chess prowess on the global stage.

title: Bengaluru murder: Mother of 4 killed by lover; body found on back seat of autorickshaw
content: Bengaluru police have detained two men, including the victim's lover, in connection with the murder of Salma, a 35-year-old domestic worker. Her body was discovered in a parked autorickshaw with head and neck injuries. Investigators believe the suspects killed her at Subramani's house after suspecting infidelity and then placed her body in the vehicle.

title: Dodgers linked to $400 million Tigers star to strengthen lineup with Ohtani, Snell
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers are reportedly eyeing a blockbuster trade for Detroit Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, potentially forming an unprecedented pitching rotation with Blake Snell and Shohei Ohtani. With contract negotiations stalled and a significant financial gap, the Tigers may opt to trade Skubal, who is projected to command a record-breaking deal.

title: Captain Shubman Gill hits new low, registers unwanted record vs Australia
content: Shubman Gill endured a challenging start as India's ODI captain, registering the lowest average by an Indian captain against Australia. Despite strong red-ball form, his white-ball struggles persist, raising questions about his long-term leadership amidst emerging talent.

title: Saudi GEA chief Turki Al-Sheikh fuels Man United buzz with viral joke, takeover hints
content: Saudi Entertainment Authority chief Turki Al-Sheikh has Manchester United fans buzzing with his social media activity.  He fueled takeover speculation with a cryptic post about an 'advanced stage' sale, then lightened the mood by reposting a fan's beard-growing challenge tied to the club's winning streak.  His comments highlight his significant influence.

title: UGC warns of fake engineering institute in Delhi; verification gaps persist
content: The UGC has warned students about the Institute of Management and Engineering in Delhi for offering unapproved engineering degrees. This action is part of a broader crackdown on fake universities, with many concentrated in Delhi and Uttar Pradesh, exploiting demand and imperfect oversight. Students are urged to verify an institution's legal status and course approvals before admission.

title: ‚ÄòNot wasting time‚Äô: Trump says no meeting with Putin until deal on Ukraine
content: US President Trump indicated a high-level summit with Russia's Putin is unlikely soon, despite a senior Kremlin envoy meeting US officials in Florida to discuss ending the Ukraine war.  Trump stressed he wouldn't waste time without a guaranteed deal.  Meanwhile, the Russian envoy expressed optimism for a diplomatic solution, even as the US and EU imposed new sanctions on Russia.

title: Virat Kohli forgets to celebrate, Rohit Sharma reminds him at SCG - Watch
content: India clinched a dominant nine-wicket victory in the final ODI against Australia, thanks to Rohit Sharma's unbeaten century and Virat Kohli's fighting half-century. Pacer Harshit Rana's four-wicket haul restricted Australia to 236. Kohli also achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second-highest ODI run-scorer, surpassing Kumar Sangakkara.

title: Chhath Puja: PM Modi extends greetings for Kharna Puja; shares folk song by 'Nirahua'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended warm wishes for Kharna Puja, a key ritual of the Chhath festival, honouring Surya Dev and Chhathi Maiya. He shared a song by Bhojpuri artist Nirahua, highlighting the festival's devotion and traditions. Preparations are underway across Bihar, Jharkhand, and eastern Uttar Pradesh, with folk songs enhancing the sacred occasion.

title: Rohit 3.0 takes guard: Opener reprises role of being a calculated accumulator
content: Rohit Sharma's recent ODI batting in Australia showcases a return to his watchful, yet explosive, style seen in 2019.  After prioritizing impact as captain, he's now embracing a senior role, focusing on grinding out innings and waiting for attacking opportunities. This strategic shift, coupled with improved fitness, has yielded positive results.

title: US-China trade talks: ‚ÄòMoving forward‚Äô towards final agreement
content: US officials indicated progress in finalizing details of a trade agreement with China, following recent talks in Malaysia. The discussions aimed to de-escalate a costly tariff dispute, with both nations seeking a resolution. This development comes amid heightened tensions and threats of further tariffs.

title: Tom Brady reignites war with Cristiano Ronaldo fans after mocking his statue
content: NFL legend Tom Brady, recently honored with a statue, playfully roasted Cristiano Ronaldo's infamous sculpture.  Brady called the Ronaldo artwork the "worst sculpture made of an athlete," sparking widespread amusement online.  This witty jab highlights Brady's enduring humor and his ability to remain a captivating figure even after his storied football career.

title: Lincoln University mass shooting: At least 5 injured on campus; what we know
content: A mass shooting disrupted Lincoln University's homecoming, injuring at least five people during a "yardfest" event.  The incident sent the campus into chaos as attendees fled, with four victims hospitalized in serious to critical condition. An investigation is underway with no suspects yet identified.

title: Rohit Sharma creates history, breaks multiple records in Australia ‚Äì Full list
content: Rohit Sharma achieved his 50th international century, a milestone only two other Indians have reached. He scored 121* against Australia in Sydney, topping the series with 202 runs and earning Player of the Match and Series. Sharma now holds records for most centuries by a visiting batter in Australia and is India's ninth-highest ODI run-getter.

title: Emiru accuses Mizkif of sexual assault and blackmail days after TwitchCon incident
content: Twitch streamer Emiru has accused fellow streamer Mizkif of sexual assault, abuse, stalking, and threats. Her decision to speak out follows a recent fan assault at TwitchCon, which she says highlighted her lack of safety. Emiru detailed a past unwanted intimate encounter and Mizkif's alleged attempts to contact her contacts and threaten her, prompting calls for Twitch to ban him.

title: Reagan ad: Trump imposes additional 10% tariffs on Canada; cites 'hostile act'
content: President Trump announced a 10% tariff increase on Canadian goods, citing a "fake" advertisement featuring Ronald Reagan. This follows the end of trade talks and ongoing sectoral tariffs, despite the USMCA agreement maintaining tariff-free trade for most goods.

title: New ‚ÄòSuper-Earth‚Äô just 18 light-years away sparks hope for life beyond our solar system
content: Astronomers have found GJ 251 c, a rocky planet. It is a super-Earth located only 18 light-years away. This planet is in its star's habitable zone. This means liquid water could exist there. The discovery brings the search for life beyond our solar system closer. Future telescopes will study GJ 251 c for signs of life.

title: 'Picture abhi baki hai': Not the end of the road for Kohli, Rohit?
content: Veteran duo Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli showcased their enduring class with a match-winning partnership, guiding India to victory. Sharma's unbeaten 121 and Kohli's 74 not out chased down Australia's 236, proving their continued impact. Irfan Pathan lauded their performance, highlighting their fitness and saying, 'the best is yet to come'.

title: 'Perform kar, warna bahar bitha dunga': How Gambhir's stern message fired up Harshit Rana
content: Harshit Rana silenced critics with a stellar 4-wicket haul against Australia in the final ODI, showcasing his talent despite selection debates. Head coach Gautam Gambhir's stern warning to perform or be dropped fueled Rana's determination, leading to a career-defining performance at the SCG.

title: Fans call to fire LSU coach Brian Kelly after A&M loss
content: Brian Kelly and LSU's 2025 season has unraveled, with a humbling loss to Texas A&M all but ending playoff hopes and fueling fan frustration. Facing a 5-3 record and a massive buyout, the program grapples with the costly reality of potential coaching changes as pressure intensifies.

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . 108 students chanted 'Kanda Sashti Kavacham' at the Kandakottam K.K. Sekarbabu .

title: How Giannis and the Bucks managed an awkward offseason
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appeared on a projector screen in the interview room . it was the first day a team could officially gather before the start of training camp . he had come down with COVID the week before and had not been cleared to travel .

content: it's human nature to assume that every trend line points endlessly in the same direction, off to some far horizon . we hear "Texas is back" each season, and we're secure in the knowledge that sooner or later, we all get to laugh about it again . despite the endless universe, there are some hard truths that are impossible to escape .

title: Round 1 preview, predictions: Can anyone stop Philly?
content: the 2025 MLS Cup playoffs kicked off on Wednesday with the wild card round, which saw the ninth seeds from both the East and West get knocked out . this phase of the postseason moves quickly, with the dust on Wednesday's Wild Card games having barely settled before inter Miami and Nashville SC get Round 1 underway on Friday night . the 'futbol Americas' crew debate who's the leading contenders to win the MLS cup .

title: Man arrested for rape and murder of woman in Begumpet
content: a 38-year-old man was arrested for the rape and murder of a woman from assam . the woman's body was found near a police station in the panjagutta area . he is charged with the murder of the woman, who was raped and murdered .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: A well-done steak for Deion, medium for Dabo: How CFB chefs please everyone's palates
content: in 2019, he was the executive chef of the Seattle Seahawks . he had applied for a culinary position with LSU before where he would be working at Tiger Stadium . in his interview, he cooked for 35 people -- executives, dieticians and other high-ranking officials .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: Buzz: Terry McLaurin ready to roll, Christian Watson on verge of return
content: our fantasy football Buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league . this looks to be the week that McLaurin returns from the quad injury that has sidelined him since Week 4 . there was some early optimism last week that he might be active in Week 7 after returning to practice .

title: 12 more NFL Week 8 games: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: this weekend's "Sunday NFL Countdown" brings exciting matchups . we have you covered with everything you need to know . our NFL Nation reporters take you inside the locker room with the best thing they heard this week .

title: Sources: Eagles not expected to trade WR Brown
content: sources say the Eagles are not expected to trade star wide receiver A.J. Brown . sources say he will not play against the Giants due to a hamstring injury . the defending champions aren't looking to move the 28-year-old .

title: Indiana reasserts 'will' with 50-point rout of UCLA
content: no team in college football had won a conference game by 50 or more points this season . the second-ranked Hoosiers led 35-3 at halftime, then opened the second half with a 10-play, 75-yard touchdown drive . UCLA is a very capable team, says his younger brother, freshman Alberto Mendoza .

title: 'Institutional murder': Rahul on Maharashtra doctor‚Äôs suicide; accuses govt of ‚Äòshielding criminals‚Äô
